alert.note: Alert for Klamath Basin; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 14 at 2:56AM PST until February 14 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Northern portions of the Klamath Basin and Klamath County. This includes the communities of Chiloquin, Chemult and Crescent and Highway 97 from Chiloquin northward. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow is expected between now and 9 am pst Tuesday. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Klamath Basin; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County
